result.execSummary:
The defendant James William Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
*NO fine.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
*Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) by 11/16/16. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 172 days served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James William Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.

As to Count 2:
Court sentenced defendant to serve  10  MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 172 days served.  
- No fine
- Provide DNA sample if not already done so
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) by  11-16-2016.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant James William Thomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant James William Thomas in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.

As to Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant James William Thomas not in court, in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
State informs Court they are prepared to proceed to trial.
Court orders case passed.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant James William Thomas not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 11-16-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.   mld

Attorney Thomas K. Hackbart in court, defendant James William Thomas not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 7-21-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TRESHYDA R.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for James William Thomas

Defendant James William Thomas in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant James William Thomas in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
